clinical_study.brief_title: In-Use Test With a Cosmetic Product to Treat Pruritus
clinical_study.official_title: In-Use Test With a Cosmetic Product (WO 3308) for Topical Use to Treat Acute or Chronic Pruritus

lead_sponsor.agency: Dr. August Wolff GmbH & Co. KG Arzneimittel

collaborator.agency: Skin Investigation and Technology Hamburg GmbH

clinical_study.source: Dr. August Wolff GmbH & Co. KG Arzneimittel

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to evaluate the cosmetic features of the product WO 3308 by means of a questionnaire in an interview situation after two weeks of product treatment, giving special consideration to the cosmetic performance, efficacy and skin compatibility and with special focus on the reduction of pruritus. Additionally the tolerance will be evaluated by a dermatologist.

primary_outcome.measure: Cosmetic Features of the Test Product
primary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline for the Cosmetic Features (spreadability, absorbtion, skin feeling after application, fragrance) of the Test Product by the means of an interview-based questionnaire
Change from Baseline Reduction of Pruritus at two weeks by the means of an interview-based questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: Tolerance of the Test Product on the skin
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline at two weeks by the means of a dermatological and subjective assessment of skin tolerance on arms and legs

arm_group.arm_group_label: WO 3308 Cosmetic Product for Topical Use
arm_group.description: WO 3308 is used to treat acute or chronic pruritus

intervention.intervention_name: WO 3308 Cosmetic Product for Topical Use
intervention.description: Application on the entire body at least once a day over two weeks
intervention.arm_group_label: WO 3308 Cosmetic Product for Topical Use

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age: â‰¥ 18 years
- sex: approx. 25% to 50% male and 50% to 75% female
- with acute pruritus (lasts less than 6 weeks) or chronic pruritus (lasts longer than 6 weeks): max. 50% with acute pruritus and at least 50% with chronic pruritus
Exclusion Criteria:
- any deviation from the above-mentioned criteria
- known incompatibilities to cosmetics and ingredients of cosmetic test products (please see INCI)
- topical medication in the test area within 1 month prior to study start
- systemic medication with antibiotics within 2 weeks prior to starting of the study
- change in the medication with anti-inflammatory agents within 2 weeks prior to starting the study
- systemic medication with immunomodulators (immunsuppressive drugs in the course of a transplantation) and/or chemotherapeutic agents within 4 weeks prior to starting the study
- neurodermatitis (atopic dermatitis)
- pregnancy and period of breastfeeding
